intro: Appendicula leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte appendicula, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
